definition: to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
lit. slow no aid to urgent (idiom); slow measures will not address a critical situation/too slow to meet a pressing need

sentences.english: The lot of unwilling foreigners is far worse still.
sentences.chinese: 很多心不甘情不愿的外国人的命运实在不济。

sentences.english: None of the great composers had a more unfortunate talent-to-luck ratio than Franz Schubert.
sentences.chinese: 从没有一个伟大的作曲家像舒伯特那样的时运不济。

sentences.english: The moles and birthmarks in these areas can indicate good fortune, or a lack of it.
sentences.chinese: 痣或胎记落到这些区域有可能象征好运或时运不济。

sentences.english: Calls for ever-greater United Nations effectiveness under conditions of poor financial situation make no sense.
sentences.chinese: 在财力不济的情况下呼吁大联合国的效率毫无意义。

sentences.english: It worked against Forlan. It should work in favor of Suarez.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰时运不济，但现在的时机非常适合苏亚雷斯。

sentences.english: Old Mr Black loved shooting bears, but his eyes were not good any more.
sentences.chinese: 布莱克老先生酷爱猎熊，只是他的眼力已经不济事了。

sentences.english: To all appearances he was just the commonplace planter who had fallen upon evil days .
sentences.chinese: 表面上看来，他完全是个时运不济的普通种植园主。

sentences.english: Unprofitable eloquence is like the cypress, which is GREat and tall, but bears no fruit.
sentences.chinese: 无益雄辩不济事，犹如柏树参天不结果。

sentences.english: Too much spoils, too little is nothing.
sentences.chinese: 过多反坏事，太少不济事。

sentences.english: Too abundance spoils, too less is nothing.
sentences.chinese: 太多会坏事，太少不济事。

definition: lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
controlled (by sb)/to suffer under a yoke
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: It's hard to clap with only one hand./It takes two to tango/It's difficult to achieve anything without support.
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
